greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Unitary totient (or unitary phi) function uphi(n).
comment: Unitary convolution of A076479 and A000027. - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 13 2011
Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^e - 1. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 30 2013
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eckford Cohen, Arithmetical functions associated with the unitary divisors of an integer, Math. Zeitschr. 74 (1960) 66-80
Steven R. Finch, Unitarism and Infinitarism, February 25, 2004. [Cached copy, with permission of the author]
M. Lal, Iterates of the unitary totient function, Math. Comp., 28 (1974), 301-302.
R. J. Mathar, Survey of Dirichlet Series of Multiplicative Arithmetic Functions, arXiv:1106.4038 [math.NT], 2011, Remark 43.
L. Toth, On the Bi-Unitary Analogues of Euler's Arithmetical Function and the Gcd-Sum Function, JIS 12 (2009) 09.5.2.
L. Toth, A survey of gcd-sum functions, J. Int. Seq. 13 (2010) # 10.8.1.
formula: If n = Product p_i^e_i, uphi(n) = Product (p_i^e_i - 1).
a(n) = A000010(n)*A000203(A003557(n))/A003557(n). - _Velin Yanev_ and _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 23 2017
a(n) >= phi(n) = A000010(n), with equality if and only if n is squarefree (A005117). (End)
Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ c * Pi^2 * n^2 / 12, where c = A065464 = Product_{primes p} (1 - 2/p^2 + 1/p^3). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 15 2020
mathematica: uphi[n_] := (Times @@ (Table[ #[[1]]^ #[[2]] - 1, {1} ] & /@ FactorInteger[n]))[[1]]; Table[ uphi[n], {n, 2, 75}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 06 2004 *)
uphi[n_] := If[n==1, 1, Product[{p, e} = pe; p^e-1, {pe, FactorInteger[n]}] ]; Array[uphi, 80] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 17 2018 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=1, 100, print1(direuler(p=2, n, (1 - 2*X + p*X^2)/(1-X)/(1-p*X))[n], ", ")) \\ _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 15 2020
f x uph = f (x `div` sppf) (uph * (sppf - 1)) where sppf = a028233 x
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
